## Australia and its monetary policy {style="color:#ff68b4;"}

::: footer
[bsvars.org](https://bsvars.org)
:::

- Australia is a small open economy
  - foreign sector determines its macroeconomic outcomes
  - domestic sector does not affect the foreigns sector
- its macroeconomic outcomes are jointly determined in a dynamic system
- its currency floats
- most of its international exchange in underwritten in UD dollars


## Australia and its monetary policy {style="color:#ff68b4;"}

::: footer
[bsvars.org](https://bsvars.org)
:::

- the Reserve Bank of Australia conducts monetary policy
  - they set the cash rate
  - they target inflation as per price stability mandate
  - they target full employment as per dual mandate
  - they coordinate the policy with central banks of other inflation-targeting countries

## <span style='color: #ff68b4;'>effects estimation using bsvarSIGNs</span> {background-color="#ededed"} 

::: footer
[bsvars.org](https://bsvars.org)
:::

```{r}
#| cache: true
data <- readxl::read_excel("VARData.xlsx")
data[, 3:7] <- 100 * log(data[, 3:7])

domestic <- ts(
  data[, 2:5],
  start = c(1982, 1),
  frequency = 4
)
plot.ts(domestic)
```


## <span style='color: #ff68b4;'>effects estimation using bsvarSIGNs</span> {background-color="#ededed"} 

::: footer
[bsvars.org](https://bsvars.org)
:::

```{r}
#| cache: true
foreign <- ts(
  data[, 6:8],
  start = c(1982, 1),
  frequency = 4
)
plot(foreign)
```



## <span style='color: #ff68b4;'>effects estimation using bsvarSIGNs</span> {background-color="#ededed"} 

::: footer
[bsvars.org](https://bsvars.org)
:::

```{r}
#| cache: true
# restrictions on impulse response functions
sign_irf <- matrix(NA, 4, 4)
sign_irf[1, 1] <- sign_irf[4, 1] <- 1     # impact on cash rate and exchange rate
sign_irf[3, 1] <- -1                      # impact on consumer price index
sign_irf <- array(sign_irf, c(4, 4, 4))   # last for 4 periods
sign_irf[, , 1]

sign_structural <- matrix(NA, 4, 4)
sign_structural[1, ] <- c(1, -1, -1, 1)
sign_structural
```



## <span style='color: #ff68b4;'>effects estimation using bsvarSIGNs</span> {background-color="#ededed"} 

::: footer
[bsvars.org](https://bsvars.org)
:::

```{r}
#| cache: true
library(bsvarSIGNs)

spec <- specify_bsvarSIGN$new(
  domestic,
  p = 4,
  exogenous = foreign,
  sign_irf = sign_irf,
  sign_structural = sign_structural
)
```

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| cache: true
spec$prior$Ysoc <- matrix(NA, nrow(spec$prior$Ysoc), 0)
spec$prior$Xsoc <- matrix(NA, nrow(spec$prior$Xsoc), 0)
spec$prior$Ysur <- matrix(NA, nrow(spec$prior$Ysur), 0)
spec$prior$Xsur <- matrix(NA, nrow(spec$prior$Xsur), 0)
```

```{r}
#| cache: true
post <- estimate(spec, S = 5000)
```



## <span style='color: #ff68b4;'>effects estimation using bsvarSIGNs</span> {background-color="#ededed"} 

::: footer
[bsvars.org](https://bsvars.org)
:::

```{r}
#| cache: true
irf <- compute_impulse_responses(post, horizon = 20)
plot(irf, probability = 0.68)
```
